Name: Thuir Sour
Ingredients: 15 ml De Kuyper Apricot Brandy liqueur
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
22.5 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Perfectly balanced sweet and sour apricot with faint red wine notes.
History: Adapted from a drink created in 2015 by Stuart Bale of 69 Colebrooke Row, London during a visit to Thuir in the South of France where Byrrh has been made since the 1870s. When Stuart asked what Thuir was famous for, apart from Byrrh, the locals claimed their apricots were the best in the world. Hence Stuart’s use of Byrrh and crème d’apricot in this cocktail.
Nutrition: One serving of Thuir Sour contains 109 calories
